title: Section 1:  BIOS Configuration
content:
Owned by Carl Weissler Last updated: Aug 03, 2015 by Carl Weissler

Prerequisites:

1.  Ensure the latest version (or version under test) of OpenXT with Tools is available on CD/DVD.

2.  Ensure a netboot server with the appropriate files is available.

3.  Ensure the system under test has at least two graphics cards (including the onboard).

4.  Ensure there is a USB device available for testing.

 

Virtualization Technologies

1.1)  Enable Intel VT-x

1.2)  Enable Intel VT-d

1.3)  Enable Intel TXT

 

Other Actions

Intel Integrated Graphics (if present)

1.4)  Enable IGFX

1.5)  Set IGFX as primary display device

1.6)  Set SATA Mode to AHCI

 

TPM Actions

1.7)  Clear TPM

1.8)  Enable TPM

1.9)  Activate TPM

Author: tshanahan Date: 2015-06-02T20:11:07.894Z Comment: Carl - with the Q77 we disabled the Intel AMT function and set the Boot Mode Selection to Legacy only, are those required for this?

Author: Kevin Pearson Date: 2015-07-29T14:18:37.818Z Comment: The AMT is not an OpenXT-specific configurability option (in fact some OpenXT environments actively use it) but currently the Legacy/CSM boot option is. I'll add that here.
